summary: So I got to meet the WONDERFUL Taliesin Axelrod Jaffe at GenCon! He was wearing his "Daisy Bait" outfit, and my equally...
body:
So I got to meet the WONDERFUL Taliesin Axelrod Jaffe at GenCon! He was wearing his “Daisy Bait” outfit, and my equally wonderful friends messaged me to get me to run down to the convention centre from the local Steak and Shake.

He gave me like a billion hugs and I cried on him a lot because I’d been really dissaponted that everyone else got to meet him, but I’d just gotten really unlucky.

I told him that I was really self concious about my laugh, as I’ve received both IRL and online. He gave me extra hugs and told me that apparently Travis Willingham had texted Sam Reigel that he was annoyed that there was a person in the audience who kept standing up and making the chairs squeak every time something happened! Sam replied that it wasn’t the chairs, it was a girl in the audience who was “one of Taliesin’s”

I’m not entirely sure what to take from being “one of Taliesin’s” but if it just means being a Wednesdaisy then I will gladly come under the collective ;)

summary: I drew this the day before the “Found and lost” episode, thinking I was gonna wait to post it until I had enough sketches for a...
caption:
I drew this the day before the “Found and lost” episode, thinking I was gonna wait to post it until I had enough sketches for a proper sketch dump, but I kinda lost my momentum after the episode aired. It was only supposed to be some cute and happy little sketches…

I don’t think I’ve been this upset about a fictional character death ever, and Molly isn’t even my favourite character from CR lmao. I’m sad we won’t get to see were his story would have gone.

reblog.comment:

summary:
I got to meet Pu-Matt!!! 
He spotted my Gilmore Patch and told me that he'd heard a lot about his work. He's gonna give his...
caption:
I got to meet Pu-Matt!!!
He spotted my Gilmore Patch and told me that he’d heard a lot about his work. He’s gonna give his novel “Feathered Leather” a try. Sure, it might not be safe for work, but that doesn’t matter so much when you’re the only one working there.

(No seriously, Matt was amazing, had a proper conversation with us all in character and posed for selfies and I just love him)

summary: Early dawn began to break through the sky. The faint lightening of the night’s dark blues slowly raise in brightness, and soft...
body:
Early dawn began to break through the sky. The faint lightening of the night’s dark blues slowly raise in brightness, and soft saturated colors of morning begin to form. Just as the soft padding of feet shuffling in the morning. Clothes and armor being shifted around, as bodies, still moistened by sweat and the encumberments of the night before.

It was strange riding a low, then a high only to be…at a neutral place. Keg never thought she’d be here. In a bed with a human woman, watching her stretch in the nude similar yet…not as impressive as she demonstrated a few hours ago. “So….that was fun.” Keg chuckled awkwardly breaking the silence as she slowly sat up from the bed, shaking off the linens from her bare, scar covered body. Her muscles ached, they had no rest not between battle and play. “You’re very uh…” she paused as Beau slowly righted herself from a downward stretch, curling her spine up into a perfect postured stand. “Bendy.”

“Yea” Beau didn’t even try to not sound smug. Just the look of her smirk made Keg shift back to bed an inch more. “It’s kinda…a monk thing.” Beauregard walked over and stood by the edge of the bed. Her hands slowly moving up and down the tight, thick barrel like arms of the dwarvian woman she invited to her bed last night. “I might have shown off a bit.”

“Yea that thing you did…I thought you were going to split in half, I didn’t know legs could DO that” Keg chuckled with a growing blush. A small purr erupted from her as Beau’s hands moved up her hair covered arms to her scruffed chin.

The dark skinned human woman smirked, her eyes gleamed with mischief as she leaned in a bit closer. “Hey…just celebrating a job well done.”

Keg welcomed her kiss. Days of being around her she wasn’t disappointed now that she finally got to experience Beauregard and all her…forms. She saw her rage, her power, her softness and vulnerabilities. Last night she saw passion and a subtle desire to be cared for. This was an addicting sort of feeling. The warmth that brewed in her stout gut like fresh ale.

Just as fast as the warm emptied into her gut from Beau’s mouth, it left. As the human girl looked out at the day with a sudden stern expression. She pulled a ribbon from the ground and began pulling her hair up into its signature bun, exposing her undercut. “So, have you figured out what you’re doing next?”

“Nope.” Keg slowly began to move now. Seeing Beauregard slowly fish for clothing from the room made her uneasy, as though she too, had to start. “But I feel less shitty about it. I figure I’ll find some work, make some money…maybe…what’s that thing you and Caleb mentioned? The thing…you’re uh…friend use to say.”

“‘Leave a town better than you left it’” Beau answered softly. “Yea…that’s a solid quarter of a plan.”

“I was …also thinking, if you guys are done here…maybe…you’d want to come with me?” Keg paused to look at Beau’s reaction. Her body stopped for a second and Keg felt her insides curl into itself. “It was a stupid idea…you have your friends and your business…”

“I couldn’t…” Beauregard muttered. “We just got them back…and we’re not all here.”

“What…do you mean?” Keg paused, “you saved your friends from Lorenzo, the fight is over.”

“The fight is, but they’re still weak and we still have to handle Mollymauk’s…thing.” Beau looked over at Keg. “When Jester and Fjord and…oh god, when Yasha finds out…” Beauregard slowly began to rub the back of her neck in slow, almost thoughtful motions. “Yasha…”

“Was she…the big lady? In the cage by herself.” Keg inquired a bit, Beau’s face lit up with a slight flush, she nodded slow. “I mean I’d stick around but I’m not sure…if I wanna be around for any sort of crazy magic shit…I was kinda thrown off by last night’s battle with Lorenzo and all that crap he pulled out.”

“Keg, the idea of running off with you or any girl sounds great. And trust me if you asked me like…I dunno a few weeks ago even, I might have skipped off on these guys. But I can’t now. Jester and Fjord are real beaten up…Caleb is constantly getting hurt, Nott is a shifty little fuck, Dueces is way to new to be left alone with any of them and Yasha…she….she needs uh…she needs us more now that we’re down one.”

Keg’s eyes scanned over Beauregard a few times. She slowly moved to picking up her bigger pieces of armor, nodding slow as Beau explained herself. “Your friends are important to you. I respect that.” She paused as she slung on her heavy chest armor. “Especially that Yasha.” Her chapped lips curled into a smirk that disarmed Beau.

She tried to recompose herself, failing at tying her own sash out of frustration. “It’s not like that, Yasha…she’s not into me…”

“And you?”

Beauregard pursed her lips a little, giving Keg a little glare.

“What?” Keg began to laugh, before covering her mouth, remembering the rest of nein were only a room away. “It’s kinda obvious. Here I thought you were pretty slick with your sweet talking.”

“Tch, well…let’s just say I haven’t found a way to talk Yasha into my bed…there’ll be less of that now that all this is happening…the fight is over but we still have so much damage control…so much to do….” Beau smiled a sort of somber, desperate smile. “We’re never going to be the same…I have no idea what comes after this and I was hoping last night could …I don’t fucking know, last a little longer.”

“Today was going to come whether we wanted to or not. The world still spins, but at least you’re not going back.” Keg finally pieced up her last bit of armor and began walking out of the room, as Beau, now dressed as well walked after her. “Seeing me out?”

“Nah…just have somewhere to be.” She patted Keg’s back. “Don’t be a stranger.”

“Oh don’t worry, if I see any weird, freaky trouble I’ll just assume the Mighty Nein is nearby.” Keg chortled disappearing around the hall.

Beauregard watched her with a small smile before turning to the room across from her. Her smile faded as she entered finding Nott, curled up by Jester and Fjord’s side. Caleb, sleeping on the floor, hand clutching a heart shaped pendant on his neck. Somewhere Cadueces was probably outside making tea or feeding his insects in the meantime.

In a bed all of her own, Yasha’s massive frame, built and bruised laid there, sleeping soundly.

With a shaky breath Beau went to her, kneeling down by her bed. She gently took Molly’s tarot cards and placed it on the nightstand by the bed with a pained smile. “We brought them home…so you don’t have to worry” She muttered softly, as moisture welled in her eyes. Her body froze when she felt a large hand curl around her face in a tender touch. She felt her heart race and sink down all at once, her eyes wide and out pouring as Yasha’s eyes were barely opened all the way, but staring her down.

“Beau?” She croaked. “B-Beau is …is uh…that you?” Yasha tried to move and winced a bit.

“Yea, yea it’s me” Beauregard quickly placed her hand on her shoulder. “We’re all here…and we’re safe.” She paused feeling her words run rancid in her mouth. “Well…almost all of us…” Her hand softly land over the top of the tarot cards.

reblog.comment:

In the cage by herself.” Keg inquired a bit, Beau’s face lit up with a slight flush, she nodded slow. “I mean I’d stick around but I’m not sure…if I wanna be around for any sort of crazy magic shit…I was kinda thrown off by last night’s battle with Lorenzo and all that crap he pulled out.”

“Keg, the idea of running off with you or any girl sounds great. And trust me if you asked me like…I dunno a few weeks ago even, I might have skipped off on these guys. But I can’t now. Jester and Fjord are real beaten up…Caleb is constantly getting hurt, Nott is a shifty little fuck, Dueces is way to new to be left alone with any of them and Yasha…she….she needs uh…she needs us more now that we’re down one.”

Keg’s eyes scanned over Beauregard a few times. She slowly moved to picking up her bigger pieces of armor, nodding slow as Beau explained herself. “Your friends are important to you. I respect that.” She paused as she slung on her heavy chest armor. “Especially that Yasha.” Her chapped lips curled into a smirk that disarmed Beau.

She tried to recompose herself, failing at tying her own sash out of frustration. “It’s not like that, Yasha…she’s not into me…”

“And you?”

Beauregard pursed her lips a little, giving Keg a little glare.

“What?” Keg began to laugh, before covering her mouth, remembering the rest of nein were only a room away. “It’s kinda obvious. Here I thought you were pretty slick with your sweet talking.”

“Tch, well…let’s just say I haven’t found a way to talk Yasha into my bed…there’ll be less of that now that all this is happening…the fight is over but we still have so much damage control…so much to do….” Beau smiled a sort of somber, desperate smile. “We’re never going to be the same…I have no idea what comes after this and I was hoping last night could …I don’t fucking know, last a little longer.”

“Today was going to come whether we wanted to or not. The world still spins, but at least you’re not going back.” Keg finally pieced up her last bit of armor and began walking out of the room, as Beau, now dressed as well walked after her. “Seeing me out?”

“Nah…just have somewhere to be.” She patted Keg’s back. “Don’t be a stranger.”

“Oh don’t worry, if I see any weird, freaky trouble I’ll just assume the Mighty Nein is nearby.” Keg chortled disappearing around the hall.

Beauregard watched her with a small smile before turning to the room across from her. Her smile faded as she entered finding Nott, curled up by Jester and Fjord’s side. Caleb, sleeping on the floor, hand clutching a heart shaped pendant on his neck. Somewhere Cadueces was probably outside making tea or feeding his insects in the meantime.

In a bed all of her own, Yasha’s massive frame, built and bruised laid there, sleeping soundly.

With a shaky breath Beau went to her, kneeling down by her bed. She gently took Molly’s tarot cards and placed it on the nightstand by the bed with a pained smile. “We brought them home…so you don’t have to worry” She muttered softly, as moisture welled in her eyes. Her body froze when she felt a large hand curl around her face in a tender touch. She felt her heart race and sink down all at once, her eyes wide and out pouring as Yasha’s eyes were barely opened all the way, but staring her down.

“Beau?” She croaked. “B-Beau is …is uh…that you?” Yasha tried to move and winced a bit.

“Yea, yea it’s me” Beauregard quickly placed her hand on her shoulder. “We’re all here…and we’re safe.” She paused feeling her words run rancid in her mouth. “Well…almost all of us…” Her hand softly land over the top of the tarot cards.

trail.content_raw:
Early dawn began to break through the sky. The faint lightening of the night’s dark blues slowly raise in brightness, and soft saturated colors of morning begin to form. Just as the soft padding of feet shuffling in the morning. Clothes and armor being shifted around, as bodies, still moistened by sweat and the encumberments of the night before.

It was strange riding a low, then a high only to be…at a neutral place. Keg never thought she’d be here. In a bed with a human woman, watching her stretch in the nude similar yet…not as impressive as she demonstrated a few hours ago. “So….that was fun.” Keg chuckled awkwardly breaking the silence as she slowly sat up from the bed, shaking off the linens from her bare, scar covered body. Her muscles ached, they had no rest not between battle and play. “You’re very uh…” she paused as Beau slowly righted herself from a downward stretch, curling her spine up into a perfect postured stand. “Bendy.”

“Yea” Beau didn’t even try to not sound smug. Just the look of her smirk made Keg shift back to bed an inch more. “It’s kinda…a monk thing.” Beauregard walked over and stood by the edge of the bed. Her hands slowly moving up and down the tight, thick barrel like arms of the dwarvian woman she invited to her bed last night. “I might have shown off a bit.”

“Yea that thing you did…I thought you were going to split in half, I didn’t know legs could DO that” Keg chuckled with a growing blush. A small purr erupted from her as Beau’s hands moved up her hair covered arms to her scruffed chin.

The dark skinned human woman smirked, her eyes gleamed with mischief as she leaned in a bit closer. “Hey…just celebrating a job well done.”

Keg welcomed her kiss. Days of being around her she wasn’t disappointed now that she finally got to experience Beauregard and all her…forms. She saw her rage, her power, her softness and vulnerabilities. Last night she saw passion and a subtle desire to be cared for. This was an addicting sort of feeling. The warmth that brewed in her stout gut like fresh ale.

Just as fast as the warm emptied into her gut from Beau’s mouth, it left. As the human girl looked out at the day with a sudden stern expression. She pulled a ribbon from the ground and began pulling her hair up into its signature bun, exposing her undercut. “So, have you figured out what you’re doing next?”

“Nope.” Keg slowly began to move now. Seeing Beauregard slowly fish for clothing from the room made her uneasy, as though she too, had to start. “But I feel less shitty about it. I figure I’ll find some work, make some money…maybe…what’s that thing you and Caleb mentioned? The thing…you’re uh…friend use to say.”

“‘Leave a town better than you left it’” Beau answered softly. “Yea…that’s a solid quarter of a plan.”

“I was …also thinking, if you guys are done here…maybe…you’d want to come with me?” Keg paused to look at Beau’s reaction. Her body stopped for a second and Keg felt her insides curl into itself. “It was a stupid idea…you have your friends and your business…”

“I couldn’t…” Beauregard muttered. “We just got them back…and we’re not all here.”

“What…do you mean?” Keg paused, “you saved your friends from Lorenzo, the fight is over.”

“The fight is, but they’re still weak and we still have to handle Mollymauk’s…thing.” Beau looked over at Keg. “When Jester and Fjord and…oh god, when Yasha finds out…” Beauregard slowly began to rub the back of her neck in slow, almost thoughtful motions. “Yasha…”

“Was she…the big lady? In the cage by herself.” Keg inquired a bit, Beau’s face lit up with a slight flush, she nodded slow. “I mean I’d stick around but I’m not sure…if I wanna be around for any sort of crazy magic shit…I was kinda thrown off by last night’s battle with Lorenzo and all that crap he pulled out.”

“Keg, the idea of running off with you or any girl sounds great. And trust me if you asked me like…I dunno a few weeks ago even, I might have skipped off on these guys. But I can’t now. Jester and Fjord are real beaten up…Caleb is constantly getting hurt, Nott is a shifty little fuck, Dueces is way to new to be left alone with any of them and Yasha…she….she needs uh…she needs us more now that we’re down one.”

Keg’s eyes scanned over Beauregard a few times. She slowly moved to picking up her bigger pieces of armor, nodding slow as Beau explained herself. “Your friends are important to you. I respect that.” She paused as she slung on her heavy chest armor. “Especially that Yasha.” Her chapped lips curled into a smirk that disarmed Beau.

She tried to recompose herself, failing at tying her own sash out of frustration. “It’s not like that, Yasha…she’s not into me…”

“And you?”

Beauregard pursed her lips a little, giving Keg a little glare.

“What?” Keg began to laugh, before covering her mouth, remembering the rest of nein were only a room away. “It’s kinda obvious. Here I thought you were pretty slick with your sweet talking.”

“Tch, well…let’s just say I haven’t found a way to talk Yasha into my bed…there’ll be less of that now that all this is happening…the fight is over but we still have so much damage control…so much to do….” Beau smiled a sort of somber, desperate smile. “We’re never going to be the same…I have no idea what comes after this and I was hoping last night could …I don’t fucking know, last a little longer.”

“Today was going to come whether we wanted to or not. The world still spins, but at least you’re not going back.” Keg finally pieced up her last bit of armor and began walking out of the room, as Beau, now dressed as well walked after her. “Seeing me out?”

“Nah…just have somewhere to be.” She patted Keg’s back. “Don’t be a stranger.”

“Oh don’t worry, if I see any weird, freaky trouble I’ll just assume the Mighty Nein is nearby.” Keg chortled disappearing around the hall.

Beauregard watched her with a small smile before turning to the room across from her. Her smile faded as she entered finding Nott, curled up by Jester and Fjord’s side. Caleb, sleeping on the floor, hand clutching a heart shaped pendant on his neck. Somewhere Cadueces was probably outside making tea or feeding his insects in the meantime.

In a bed all of her own, Yasha’s massive frame, built and bruised laid there, sleeping soundly.

With a shaky breath Beau went to her, kneeling down by her bed. She gently took Molly’s tarot cards and placed it on the nightstand by the bed with a pained smile. “We brought them home…so you don’t have to worry” She muttered softly, as moisture welled in her eyes. Her body froze when she felt a large hand curl around her face in a tender touch. She felt her heart race and sink down all at once, her eyes wide and out pouring as Yasha’s eyes were barely opened all the way, but staring her down.

“Beau?” She croaked. “B-Beau is …is uh…that you?” Yasha tried to move and winced a bit.

“Yea, yea it’s me” Beauregard quickly placed her hand on her shoulder. “We’re all here…and we’re safe.” She paused feeling her words run rancid in her mouth. “Well…almost all of us…” Her hand softly land over the top of the tarot cards.

These lovable damn losers 

[SUBMISIONS: OPEN]

summary:
Yasha: Okay, so I just wanted to check. How does Beau feel about murder? 
Molly: It's frouned upon.
Yasha: Okay, but like, what...
body:
Yasha: Okay, so I just wanted to check. How does Beau feel about murder?

Molly: It’s frouned upon.

Yasha: Okay, but like, what if murdering someone will make my life easier? That’s okay, right?
